data.enText: removal of anxiety/pain
the feeling of happiness that you have when sth unpleasant stops or does not happen
a sense of relief

data.chText: 他走了以后，我们大家都如释重负地松了口气。
data.enText: We all breathed a sigh of relief when he left.
She sighed with relief.

data.chText: 令我非常庆幸的是车并没有损坏。
data.enText: Much to my relief the car was not damaged.

data.chText: 他们平安的消息给大家带来了巨大的安慰。
data.enText: News of their safety came as a great relief.

data.chText: 能和别人谈谈这件事，感到舒心多了。
data.enText: It was a relief to be able to talk to someone about it.
What a relief !

data.chText: （焦虑、痛苦等的）减轻，消除，缓和
data.enText: the act of removing or reducing pain, anxiety, etc.
modern methods of pain relief
the relief of suffering
help

data.chText: （给灾区或交战地区人民提供的）救济，救援物品
data.enText: food, money, medicine, etc. that is given to help people in places where there has been a war or natural disaster
famine relief

data.chText: 救助机构 / 组织 / 工作者
data.enText: a relief agency/organization/worker
financial help given by the government to people who need it
on tax

data.chText: 支付按揭利息的税收减免
data.enText: relief on mortgage interest payments
sth different

data.chText: （暂时替代单调乏味事物的）调剂，轻松场面
data.enText: something that is interesting or enjoyable that replaces sth boring, difficult or unpleasant for a short period of time

data.chText: 沉闷的表演中几处轻松的情节
data.enText: a few moments of light relief in an otherwise dull performance

data.chText: 他的演讲少有轻松幽默的地方。
data.enText: There was little comic relief in his speech.

data.chText: 离开喧嚣忙碌的城市生活，来到宁静的乡村，是一种令人愉快的调剂。
data.enText: The calm of the countryside came as a welcome relief from the hustle and bustle of city life.
workers

data.hoverText: 可与单数或复数动词连用的可数名词

data.enText: a person or group of people that replaces another when they have finished working for the day or when they are sick

data.chText: 下一批换班的员工9点钟接班。
data.enText: The next crew relief comes on duty at 9 o'clock.
relief drivers
from enemy
the act of freeing a town, etc. from an enemy army that has surrounded it
in art
a way of decorating wood, stone, etc. by cutting designs into the surface of it so that some parts stick out more than others; a design that is made in this way

data.chText: 柱子上饰有描述希腊神话中的场面的高浮雕。
data.enText: The column was decorated in high relief (= with designs that stick out a lot) with scenes from Greek mythology.
The bronze doors are covered with sculpted reliefs.
making sth noticeable

data.chText: （光和色彩等产生的）醒目效果；醒目；光彩夺目
data.enText: the effect of colours, light, etc. that makes an object more noticeable than others around it

data.chText: 白雪覆盖的高山在蓝天的映衬下格外醒目。
data.enText: The snow-capped mountain stood out in sharp relief against the blue sky.

data.chText: 突出的品质；令人注目的特征
data.enText: the quality of a particular situation, problem, etc. that makes it more noticeable than before

data.chText: 目前的危机使得他们的分歧更加引人注目。
data.enText: Their differences have been thrown into sharp relief by the present crisis.

simple_means.memory_skill: re 一再 + lief〔= liev〕变轻 → 减轻；轻松

tr: the act of reducing something unpleasant (as pain or annoyance)
example: he asked the nurse for relief from the constant pain

tr: the act of freeing a city or town that has been besieged
example: he asked for troops for the relief of Atlanta

tr: aid for the aged or indigent or handicapped
example: he has been on relief for many years
the contributions provided some relief for the victims

tr: sculpture consisting of shapes carved on a surface so as to stand out from the surrounding background
the feeling that comes when something burdensome is removed or reduced
example: as he heard the news he was suddenly flooded with relief

tr: someone who takes the place of another (as when things get dangerous or difficult)
example: the star had a stand-in for dangerous scenes
we need extra employees for summer fill-ins
was the relief supposed to be protection from future harm or compensation for past injury?

tr: the condition of being comfortable or relieved (especially after being relieved of distress)
example: he enjoyed his relief from responsibility
getting it off his conscience gave him some ease
people actually accomplish more when they take time for short rests

value.def: If you feel a sense of relief, you feel happy because something unpleasant has not happened or is no longer happening.

example.ex: I breathed a sigh of relief...
example.tran: 我如释重负地松了口气。

example.ex: The news will come as a great relief to the French authorities...
example.tran: 这个消息会让法国当局大大松一口气。

example.ex: To his relief a loud knock on the door spared him from giving an explanation...
example.tran: 一声重重的敲门声让他松了一口气，他可以不用解释了。

example.ex: It's a relief to get out of the office once in a while.
example.tran: 偶尔走出办公室去透透气也是一种调剂。

value.def: If something provides relief from pain or distress, it stops the pain or distress.

example.ex: This brought considerable relief from the pain.
example.tran: 这相当大地缓解了疼痛。

example.ex: ...a self-help programme which can give lasting relief from the torment of hay fever.
example.tran: 可以持续缓解枯草热病痛的自助项目

value.tran: (疼痛或苦痛的)解除，免除，减轻，缓解

value.def: Relief is money, food, or clothing that is provided for people who are very poor, or who have been affected by war or a natural disaster.

example.ex: Relief agencies are stepping up efforts to provide food, shelter and agricultural equipment.
example.tran: 救济机构正加大力度提供食物、住所和农用器械。

value.def: A relief worker is someone who does your work when you go home, or who is employed to do it instead of you when you are sick.
A relief is a sculpture that is carved out of a flat vertical surface.

trans: 松了口气；浮雕一般；鲜明地
泄压阀；减压阀；泄放阀；溢流阀；安全阀
救济工作；救灾工作；救援工作；社会救济
减压；降压；压力释放；压力分散
应力释放；应力消除；应力消除实验；應力消除；压力消除
救济金；救济资金；救助金；救济基金
溢流阀；泄压阀；安全阀；压力释放阀；减压阀
救灾物资；救济物资；救援物资
凸版印刷；击版印刷；凸版技法；凸印

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to raise, to lighten 提高, 举起；变轻
rootsaffixes.title: lev, liev

partsOfSpeech.dec: al 加强 + levi 提高，举起；变轻 + ate 做，造成，使… → 不断变轻 → 减轻
e 出 + lev 提高，举起；变轻 + ate 做，造成，使… → 举出 → 举起
ir 不 + relevant 相关的 → 不相干的，不切题的
lev 提高，举起；变轻 + ee 与…有关的物 → 提高防洪堤的高度来防洪 → 防洪堤
lev 提高，举起；变轻 + el 地点 → 举到同一高度 → 平的
lev 提高，举起；变轻 + er 表物 → 举起〔重物〕的物 → 杠杆
lev 提高，举起；变轻 + it 走 + ate 使… → 举起某物 → 使升到空中
lev 提高，举起；变轻 + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 变轻 → 轻浮
lev 提高，举起；变轻 + y 表行为 → 提高〔政府收入〕→ 征税
re 一再 + lev 提高，举起；变轻 + ant …的 → 一再想提高的 →〔态度〕中肯的
re 一再 + lief〔= liev〕提高，举起；变轻 → 减轻；轻松
re 一再 + liev 提高，举起；变轻 + e → 使再三变轻 → 减轻
